bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the U.S.,
Monrovia, La, June 30th, 1879.
Mr. J. H. Smyth to the Ass't Sec'y of State.
Subject:
Returns and accounts.
Synopsis:
The quarterly returns and accounts and semi annual return of passports issued, quarterly returns for the 4th quarter, 1879.

Consulate General of the U.S.,
Monrovia, La, June 30th, 1879
Sir:
I have the honor to respectfully transmit herewith my quarterly returns and account for the 4th quarter, 1879.

The same consit of the following inclosures: The digest of the Invoice Book; register of official dispatches and letters received at the legation and consulate general; register of official dispatches sent from legation and consulate general with amount of postage paid-named, and receipt
Hon. F. W. Seward,
Ass't Sec'y of State,
Washington
receipt of Post Master; list of arrivals and departures of American vessels, return of deceased American citizens, and abstract of passports issued during the half year ending June 30, 1879; rent and miscellaneous expense account vouchers, a transcript of Invoice Book, an abstract of contingent expenses of legation; and inclose a receipt for £3-8-8. There should be an additional receipt for £2-3-10, making a total of £5-12-6; this was partially the result of a mistake in sending the Illustrated London News instead of the Daily Times- which I desired. You will observe the correction made, but an absence of receipt
receipt for £2-3-10, on account of my letter containing drafts in payment- to B. F. Stevens, London- not having reached England in time for an answer to be sent inclosing receipt for balance.

Salary account and accompanying certificate. In the account, I have returned the U.S. balance of $40.71 from account of Relief of Destitute American Seamen, according to my balance heretofore reported, and as appears from the adjustment of said account by Fst. Comptroller.
I am, Sir, With higest sentiments of esteem and consideration, Your obedient servant

Jno. H. Smyth,
Jno. H. Smyth,
U.S. Minister Resd't & Consul Gen'l
List of Inclosures.

1. Digest of the Invoice Book,
2. Register of official letters rec'd,
3. Do. Do. sent,
4. Arrival and departure of American vessels,
5. Return of deceased American citizens,
6. Abstract of passports issued,
7. Rent and miscellaneous expense a/c vouchers,
8. Transcript of Invoice Book,
9. Abstract of conting't exn's & voucher,
10. Salary account.
Form No. 114 121.

Names of all Deceased American Citizens, including Seamen or Mariners, together with the value of the personal effects belonging to them, and taken possession of by or deposited with Jno H Smyth, U.S. Consul at Monrovia, La, from 1st April to 30th June, inclusive.

row.cell: Of What Place A Native Or Resident.
If A Seaman, To What Vessel Belonging.

div1.p: Form No. 116.
Abstract of the Names and Description of Persons to whom Passports have been issued at the Consulate of the United States at Monrovia, Liberia, from January 1st, to June 30th, inclusive.

row.cell: Arrived at Monrovia, Apr. 1st or thereabouts from Boston, on bk. Witch, owners Trufant & Davis, colors American. He represented several firms, Residence at Grantville, Norfolk Co. Mass., a commercial traveller. Born at Boston, Mass.

div1.p: Note.–This return to be made eery six months to the Department of State. If the individual is a native citizen of the United States, the abstract should give his place of birth; if naturalized, the date of naturalization, the place where, the name of the court by which a certificate of naturalization was granted, should be stated.
When husband, wife, and minor children expect to travel together, a single passport for the whole will suffice. For any other person in the party a separate passport will be required.
